website_summaries.verdict: This basic pad is lighter than other models, so it's easier to carry to your favorite climbing spot.
pros: Carry using waist belt,handles and shoulder straps
Measures 24 inches by 36 inches by 10 inches when closed
Measures 48 inches by 36 inches by 5 inches when opened
cons: No place to hide gear or snacks

customer_reviews.title: Safety first.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present for my son who has taken up climbing. He LOVES it. Very firm and durable so fully expect it to be a great safety item for his rock climbing. He even made a bench it will fit in so he can utilize it in his living area. Great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great crash pad!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best value crash pad out there! It's one of the cheapest pads I've found, but one of the most durable as well. I've used it for bouldering in the New River Gorge area near Fayetteville, WV and out in multiple areas near Colorado Springs, CO!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this I wasnt sure how to use it. I stood in front of it and fell onto my back. I wasn't sure what to expect, but when I fell onto the pad my torso hit first popping my neck funny and slamming my head back hard. I laid there looking at the ceiling wondering what just happened. I rolled over and saw Madrock so I decided to look it up. After seeing all the building vids I took my pad out. Now I'm sending 25ft v15s and v16s.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good but very very firm
customer_reviews.text: Good but not as soft as I like for my crash pad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crash pad for at-home rock-climbing wall
customer_reviews.text: We built a rock climbing wall in our basement for our 2.5 year old using 2 of these crash pads as "flooring". For this use, they're perfect! Only thing I was unhappy with is the color. On my computer, the "Blue" looked slightly turquoise; however, it's a true royal blue that reminds me of old school gym mats and garden tarps. Not the color I wanted, but it will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what my husband wanted
customer_reviews.text: My husband using this thing constantly for bouldering outdoors. I'm glad I got it for him, as it's gotten it's fair share of use and has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Jemeson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome and it got to my house quick!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Light but thick!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pad, came just as described and came on time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't your rock climber/boulderer have one?
customer_reviews.text: Light, 'convenient' to carry, good protection for the rock climber son.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pad for the price. Doesn't have a stash area to hold any items, but once you add that the prices go up significantly. Durable and has comfortable when hiking out on your back.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad
customer_reviews.text: You will find nothing better for this price. Being able to link them together is nice. The addition of a waistband was welcome. They now are made with closed cell foam on the front and back. Which allows you to protect rocks better, and will probably increase the life span of the pad. A great pad for someone just getting started or for filling the spots your highball pads can't get.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan J. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Really nice. Good price
customer_reviews.text: My first pad. Really nice. Good price. If I were to complain about anything it would be that the shoulder pads seem a bit stiff and could be a little better padded. Still, great pad.
customer_reviews.author: dmeyer.oc

customer_reviews.title: A great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very stable and light - easy to carry even on longer hikes. Fits very nicely next to the R3 pad.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Development Company

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, wrong product for what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my husband to use in Hanmudo class as a crash pad. The price was where we wanted to be, but when the product arrived it was just too firm for what he needed it for. We ended up sending it back. We had no problems returning it. The quality of the Mad Rock Pad was excellent, and the design for transporting was great. It just wasn't what he needed.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Hays

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crash pad
customer_reviews.text: I love Mad Rock, so I wasn't surprised that I loved this. It's not too small and has some serious cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Crash Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful crash pad. It's not squishy at all like I expected. It does well with falls. I use it for aerial fitness practices. It makes me feel much safer!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Casual bouldering
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this crash pad to use for outdoor bouldering in idyllwild and j tree. We knew it wasn't big, but spotter has to be on point in moving the mat if the route isn't completely vertical. It's easy to transport like a backpack (just be aware of narrow paths when on). It's good quality for the price but I can't help but think it will wear out quickly with the terrain we use it on. Overall, I feel it was a solid purchase for the use we will get out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Casie Kempke

customer_reviews.title: Great but suggest a different seller mine came with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great but suggest a different seller mine came with a small rip at the seem which only gets bigger considering i fall on this from 1-2+ stories up, but since it's meant to break my fall not look pretty i would still say it serves its purpose to the fullest and is perfect for the kind of person who likes to hike to their bouldering
customer_reviews.author: Makenzie Conner

customer_reviews.title: As hard as the ground
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so hard it feels like falling on the ground. I'm going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality but is really to hard to land on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crash pad
customer_reviews.text: Awesome crash pad, great quality and also has arm straps to wear as a back pack for those spots you have to hike to.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: Maybe fine for a young child
customer_reviews.text: Really small. Your not able to use it for parkour. The material inside feels weird. It’s hard and slightly unstable. Maybe fine for a young child. If you’re using it directly under a hammock for safety would be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting it to look exactly like the picture but i received it with a moustache logo on it
customer_reviews.author: TrulyJen

customer_reviews.title: For adult bodies expecting to fall a bit of a distance
customer_reviews.text: I built a rock climbing wall in my basement for my kids and got this as a pad for them. I'm sure it would work great for an adult climbing up 15 feet or something like that (although it's a bit small for such a distance) but for a little 50 pound body, it's VERY hard. If you are getting a pad for little ones, look for something softer than this. Although it's not at all what I want, I suspect it still works great for the target audience, so I'm still giving an overall positive star rating.
customer_reviews.author: ut158

customer_reviews.title: Solid pad for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine off craigslist and I think it was a good investment. Easily transported and provides some solid cushioning. I've used it a few times for bouldering and as a loveseat by the campfire (propping the back against a rock). So far it shows no signs of wear and tear and I'm its second owner.
customer_reviews.author: Transhaus

product_meta.title: Mad Rock Mad Pad (Black)
product_meta.description:
* Climbing mat:
 * Type: Crashpad
 * Applications: Boulder
 * Model: collapsible
 * Outer material: 100 % Nylon

 * Climbing mat equipment:
 * Thick padding: 13 cm
 * Carrying system: * waist belt
    * handles
    * shoulder straps
   
   

 * Dimensions climbing mat:
 * Weight: 4400 g
